Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 旦那さん
Entry.EnglishText: Husband

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>

Entry.JapaneseText: 男の子
Entry.EnglishText: Boy

Entry.JapaneseText: ザピィ
Entry.EnglishText: Zapie

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード港
Entry.EnglishText: Babilograd Harbor

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード港・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Babilograd Harbor - Grocery Store

Entry.JapaneseText: こうなったら力ずくでも 奪ってやる……祭司の座を……!!
Entry.EnglishText: If things don't change, we'll have to take the priesthood by force!

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律か……
Entry.EnglishText: Right, the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: そっか……戒律のせいで しゃべれないんだったネ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh right... She can't talk to me because of the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律のせいで、男とは 話せないようだな……
Entry.EnglishText: It seems that she can't talk to men because of the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律……ですね。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh...the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: そっか、戒律が あったんだったな……
Entry.EnglishText: Oh right, those commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律のせいで、女と 話せないんだったわね……
Entry.EnglishText: He isn't allowed to talk to women because of the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当にヒューマには 気が許せないね。
Entry.EnglishText: I truly cannot stand Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: どこの街のヒューマでも 同じさ。
Entry.EnglishText: No matter where they come from, Huma are all the same!

Entry.JapaneseText: 毎朝毎晩、おじいちゃんが 作ってくれるご飯が楽しみー！
Entry.EnglishText: I look forward to the yummy meals my grampa makes me for breakfast and dinner!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……あっ、女の人と しゃべっちゃった……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Whoops, I'm not supposed to talk to women...

Entry.JapaneseText: おじいちゃんがガジュマと 話しちゃいけないって！ だから、おじさんとは話さないよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Grampa told me never to talk to Gajuma! So I'm not talking to you.

Entry.JapaneseText: おじいちゃんはガジュマと 話しちゃいけないって 言うんだけど、どうして？
Entry.EnglishText: Grampa says not to talk to Gajuma, but I don't understand why?

Entry.JapaneseText: 女の人もガジュマもダメなら、 誰と話せばいいの？ 想像のオトモダチ？
Entry.EnglishText: If I can't talk to girls or Gajuma, who can I talk to? My imaginary friend?

Entry.JapaneseText: ウチに帰れてよかったー！ 山の上にいると、お魚が 食べられないんだもん！
Entry.EnglishText: I'm so glad to be home! They didn't have any fish to eat up on the mountain at all!

Entry.JapaneseText: キノコとか木の実ばっかり。 マフマフになった気分だったよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Nothing but nuts and mushrooms... I thought I was gonna turn into a Muffmuff!

Entry.JapaneseText: キーキーキーッ!! キキキッ！
Entry.EnglishText: Kii- Kii- Ki!! Kikiki!

Entry.JapaneseText: ウチに帰れてよかったー！ 山の上にいると、お魚が 食べられないんだもん！
Entry.EnglishText: I'm so glad to be home! They didn't have any fish to eat up on the mountain at all!

Entry.JapaneseText: キノコとか木の実ばっかり。 マフマフになった気分だったよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Nothing but nuts and mushrooms... I thought I was gonna turn into a Muffmuff!

Entry.JapaneseText: おじいちゃんが、ガジュマと 話してもイイって言ってたよ。
Entry.EnglishText: My grandpa told me I'm allowed to talk to Gajuma again.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、女の人と話すのは ダメなんだってさ…… 蒼獣様も女の人と話さないの？
Entry.EnglishText: ...But I still can't talk to girls. Is the Azure Beast also not allowed to talk to girls?

Entry.JapaneseText: ボク、外で聞こえる音って 蒼獣様の声だと思うんだぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: I think that sound coming from outside is the Azure Beast's voice.

Entry.JapaneseText: 誰も信じてくれないけど、 ボク、山の上から蒼獣様が 飛んで行くのを見たんだよ！
Entry.EnglishText: No one'll believe me, but I swear I saw the Azure Beast fly away from the mountaintop!

Entry.JapaneseText: 蒼獣様にお祈りしてるんだ…… 旅に出てるお父さんとお母さんが 元気に帰って来ますようにって！
Entry.EnglishText: I'm praying to the Azure Beast that my mama and papa come home safe!

Entry.JapaneseText: ボクのお父さんとお母さん、 絵を描く旅に出かけてるんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: They went on a trip to find stuff to paint pictures of.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、ボク、お父さんたちの絵、 よくわかんないんだー！
Entry.EnglishText: I don't understand any of their paintings, though!

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『おふろ場』 とても広い浴室であるばかりか、 天然の温泉がひかれている。 この家の中で最もセンスが良い場所。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Bathroom - Not only is this bathroom spacious, it draws its water from a natural hot spring. It's the most well appointed room in the entire house.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……いい風呂場だな……
Entry.EnglishText: This is a nice bathroom.

Entry.JapaneseText: いいなぁー泳ぎたいヨ！
Entry.EnglishText: Nice bathtub! I wanna go swimming!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……見事な浴室だ…… カレギア城を思い出すな……
Entry.EnglishText: ...This is a splendid bathroom... It reminds me of the ones in Callegea Castle...

Entry.JapaneseText: お父さん…… 温泉が好きだったな……
Entry.EnglishText: My father loved hot springs...

Entry.JapaneseText: 温泉タマゴって、 ウマイんだよなぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: Hot spring eggs are pretty delicious...

Entry.JapaneseText: お肌に良さそうね…… 長風呂になりそうだわ……
Entry.EnglishText: It looks like it would be good for my skin... I'd probably take a nice, long bath...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『習作』 おそらく練習で描いた絵だが、 パンチに欠ける普通の絵。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>-Study- What is likely a painting made in practice sits before you. It is ordinary and lacks any punch or pizzazz.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『愛のがけっぷち』 どこをどう見てもバビログラード港が 描かれているだけの風景画。 タイトルのつけ方に問題がある。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>-The Precipice of Love- No matter how you look at this painting, it just appears to be a landscape of Babilograd Harbor. The title is unfitting.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『蒼獣印のタンス』 バビログラードでは一般的なタンス。 家族の衣類がきちんと納められている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>-Azure Beast Drawers- A chest of drawers seen often in Babilograd decorated with the crest of the Azure Beast. The family's clothing is neatly put away inside.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『蒼獣印のタンスの中身』 中にヘソクリは入ってない。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>-Inside the Azure Beast Drawers- There's no money hidden inside.
